title: Hanna Somatic Exercises
page_description: Release Chronic Tension and Reclaim Your Natural Movement ðŸŒ±

childcards.title: Arch & Flatten
childcards.body:
Purpose: Release tension in the lower back and improve spinal mobility.

Steps:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Inhale and tilt your pelvis forward, arching your lower back.
3. Exhale and tilt your pelvis backward, pressing your back into the floor.
4. Repeat for 6â€“10 slow, mindful repetitions.

childcards.title: Side Bend
childcards.body:
Purpose: Release tension in the sides of the torso and improve lateral flexibility.

Steps:
1. Lie on your right side with knees bent and head resting on your right arm.
2. Inhale and lift your left shoulder toward your left hip.
3. Exhale and return to the starting position.
4. Repeat 5â€“7 times on each side.

childcards.title: Back Lift
childcards.body:
Purpose: Release tension in the upper back and shoulders.

Steps:
1. Lie on your stomach with your forehead resting on your hands.
2. Inhale and gently lift your head and chest off the floor.
3. Exhale and lower back down, relaxing completely.
4. Repeat for 5â€“7 repetitions.

childcards.title: Diagonal Arch & Curl
childcards.body:
Purpose: Release diagonal tension and improve coordination.

Steps:
1. Lie on your back with legs extended and arms relaxed.
2. Inhale as you stretch your right arm overhead and slide your left foot downward.
3. Exhale as you curl your right elbow toward your left knee.
4. Repeat 4â€“6 times on each side.

childcards.title: Washrag
childcards.body:
Purpose: Release rotational tension in the spine.

Steps:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and arms out to the sides.
2. Inhale as you drop both knees to the right and turn your head to the left.
3. Exhale as you return to center, then switch sides.
4. Repeat 4â€“6 times on each side.

childcards.title: Hip Hike
childcards.body:
Purpose: Release tension in the hips and improve pelvic mobility.

Steps:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart.
2. Inhale and lift your right hip toward your right shoulder.
3. Exhale and return to neutral, then switch sides.
4. Repeat 5â€“7 times on each side.

childcards.title: Pelvic Floor Awareness
childcards.body:
Purpose: Enhance awareness and strength of the pelvic floor muscles.

Steps:
1. Sit or lie in a comfortable position.
2. Attempt to stop the flow of urine mid-stream (do this only to identify the muscles).
3. The muscles engaged are your pelvic floor muscles.
